Earlier Sunday, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand told US television that she had visited with Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her`` doing great'' and`` maPeter King progress every day.'' Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's`` Meet The Press'' program.`` It's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury,'' she added. said he sees no reason why the military should not be considered for spending cuts as lawmakers grapple with the ballooning deficit. Colin Powell pointed out that defense spending had at one time been cut 25 percent. I don't think the defense budget should be made sacrosanct, he said. The Obama administration has proposed cutting$ 78 billion from the military budget in the next five years. Eric Schmidt and Larry Page said in an interview yesterday that they worked closely with each other and co-founder Sergey Brin on big decisions. The CEO shift won't result in major strategic changes, the executives said. We really agree on strategy, Larry Page said.`` This is really a way of changing the way we're making decisions and the way we're operating. But I definitely don't think there will be any major changes in strategy.''

Eric Schmidt commented on the management change to his more than 225,000 followers on Twitter: Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! -- With assistance from Joseph Galante and Adam Satariano in San Francisco and Alex Sherman in New York.
